relevant_findings.HEENT: PERRLA, no icterus, moist mucous membranes
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: regular rate and rhythm, soft ejection murmur audible over precordium
relevant_findings.pulmonary: breathing comfortably on room air, large anterior-posterior diameter suggestive of hyperinflation, clear to auscultation bilaterally
relevant_findings.abdominal: soft, without rebound or guarding, biliary drain in place with green-tinged clear drainage
relevant_findings.neurological: alert and oriented to person, place and time without gross focal deficit
relevant_findings.musculoskeletal: left lower extremity examined, notable for left hallux post-amputation with a clean-appearing surgical site, left second and third toes tender with palpation and movement, small blistering lesions with tense skin over the toe but no overt cellulitis or drainage visible
relevant_findings.access: peripheral intravenous access, right upper extremity arteriovenous fistula
